Name: Just Like Mama Used to Say
Description:
Bless your heart. This game utilizes the tried and true party game recipe of one person judging the cards ya’ll put down as an answer for their prompt, just like Cards Against Humanity, except you’re not gonna blush playing this with Mama (or the preacher). The theme is right there in the title as you are completing phrases your southern mama might say, like “He was sneakier than a mega-church preacher at Pappy’s hidden moonshine still.” That’s the example printed on the box. The prompts the storyteller puts down are all comparative phrases (yellow cards) and the submissions are all pairs of things (red cards) and locations (blue cards).

If the storyteller likes your submission, you keep the yellow prompt card and win once you’ve collected five.

It comes with 540 cards, but 40 of those are blanks, so you can go ahead and quote your mama for later.

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: France '40 – Withdrawal to Dunkirk
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns France '40 – Withdrawal to Dunkirk is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the last days of fighting around the Dunkirk perimeter in May 1940.

The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of five campaigns.

This book is fully compatible with the other three books in the SkirmishCampaigns France ’40 series (Battles for the Meuse, The Ghost Division, and Hunters of the Ardennes).

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and history on the campaign near Dunkirk. This book also features a bibliography of sources.

Includes: 

     12 Scenarios,
     5 Campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: France '40 – The Ghost Division
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: France '40 - The Ghost Division is a complete campaign book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on Rommel's 7th Panzer Division in the German invasion of France in May-June 1940.

The book includes ten action-packed scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the France Campaign of 1940.

Includes:

     10 Scenarios,
     3 Campaigns.


—description from the publisher

Name: Bipolar
Description:
Bipolar is an educational deckbuilding game for two players. It is a unique experience that helps the player understand the frustrations and hardships of living a life with Bipolar disorder. During the game you will try to discard different triggers before they amount to actual symptoms of bipolar behavior. To deal with both triggers and symptoms you will use your experience, visit experts, keep journals and overcome crises. But beware as both unchecked manic as depression symptoms can quickly alter your mood and cause many different effects!

—description from the publisher

Name: In Mort Veritas
Description:
These are a set of fairly simple and somewhat light-hearted wargame rules for the “Ancient” period, which I am treating as post-Biblical to circa 1000 AD; beyond this point the rise of the Feudal knight changes both the nature and tempo of warfare, which I feel is better represented as a separate sub-period covering 1000-1500 AD (discuss). These rules largely stem from discussions held between myself (Martin Clark) and Dan Cunliffe, with “constructive input” from Jim Graham and Iain Law (and you thought it was just idle bickering).

—description from the designer

Name: Hero Realms: Hydra Boss Challenge
Description: The Hydra was first published as a print-and-play card on the Hero Realms website and was unlocked during the Hero Realms Base Set Kickstarter Campaign. The Hydra was later published as an oversized card in the Lost Village Campaign Deck using campaign rules.

Name: Classic Quest
Description:
Classic Quest is a cooperative game where a group of Heroes faces a fearsome dungeon randomly generated. It is designed so that novice players can get started with this game, but it develops a progressive difficulty that is challenging even for the most experienced ones.

It is a very old-school flavour designed, intended to transport us to the classic adventure that we could enjoy in our favorite fantasy novels or the best role-playing games.

Cooperation between players will always be key to succeed.

The dungeon map will be generated randomly, changing in every game, which favors replayability. The game will have an important number of furniture elements that will help you to dive into the adventur. Dungeon monsters will play automatically according to a protocol, easy to apply and consistent.

The exploration and combat mechanics are developed in a fluid and funny way. Our goal is that you will want to play Classic Quest over and over. No forgotten games on dusty shelves!

—description from the designer

Name: David Coulthard's Kartzee
Description:
David Coulthard's Kartzee is a fun fast racing game where players have to manage their dice and tactics to be the first player to get both of their teams cars ahead of DC.

Designed by David J. Mortimer as a commission for Cooper Tires as a promotional item in the line of their Ambassador David Coulthard merchandise.

A game is played over rounds until one player ends their turn with both their cards in front of DC. At the start of a round DC moves at his current speed, which will change during the game.

Each player in turn order then performs their turn by rolling 3 dice, they must pick 1 dice for each car and then the third is used as a special tactic for one car to slip stream from a distance, overtake a car in front, nail the corners this move or to collect tactic cubes depending on what has been rolled. Tactic cubes let players manipulate the rolls on future turns. At the end of a turn the players cars will cruise up behind a car in front of them.

Managing these rolls and the numbers used for cars verses tactics is critical to success because if you enter a corner too fast you'll skid to a halt and lose your momentum and if you can get ne of your cars to punch a hole in the air for their team mate you speed will increase.

A game quick enough that you can learn to play and finish a game whilst your tires are fitted!

—description from the designer

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: France '40 – Battles for the Meuse
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: France '40 - Battles for the Meuse is a complete campaign book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the German invasion of France in May 1940. 
The book includes ten action-packed scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Includes:

     10 Scenarios,

—description from the publisher

Name: What's Your Number?
Description:
Reveal what your friends really think about the questionable things you’ve always wondered about.

Your friend secretly rates how they feel about one of 216 topics on a scale of 1-100. All other players then guess that players rating: aka their “number.”

Your friend’s number is revealed at the end of the round and everyone learns who knows that friend best… and what they really think about their topic.

—description from the publisher

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: North Africa '40-'41 – Italian Misadventure and Arrival of the DAK
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns North Africa '40-'41 - Italian Misadventure and the Arrival of the DAK is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the opening fighting in North Africa and the entry of the German Africa Corps (DAK).

The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of five campaigns.

Includes:

     12 Scenarios,
     5 Campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Norway!
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Norway! is a complete campaign book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the German invasion of Norway in April 1940.

The book includes ten action-packed scenarios that can be played alone or together in two campaigns.

Six Nationalities:
this book includes scenarios that feature German, Norwegian, British, French, French Foreign Legion and Polish units.

Maximum Replayability:
the SkirmishCampaigns' system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle:
this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Includes:

     10 Scenarios,
     2 Campaigns 


—description from the publisher

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 – First Hours
Description:
Skirmish Campaigns: Normandy '44 – First Hours is a complete campaign book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on Utah Beach and Ste. Marie du Mont.

The book includes ten action-packed scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Includes:

     10 scenarios,
     3 campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr
This is the companion book of Normandy-First Hours.

It is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the US drive from Omaha Beach to St. Lo in June 1944 and the counterattack of the German Panzer Lehr Division in Normandy in July 1944.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the campaign for Normandy in 1944. This book also features an annotated bibliography that is especially taylored to the reader interested in tactical battles in Normandy 1944.

Includes: 

     11 Scenarios,
     3 Campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: Outlands Mission: I've Soiled My Plants
Description:
I've Soiled My Plants is an OUTLANDS mission where both players have to 'sow' a seed in a patch of 'Spice Enriched Soil', wait for the seed to germinate and then take the Sapling back to Prof. Maria Topaisz. 
A little spot of  gardening never hurt anyone...its the bullets whizzing past your ears that cause the damage.

So a reasonable simple and straight forward mission that experienced players shouldn't have a problem completing on the 2nd or 3rd attempt. 
That's why I've Soiled my Plants has 3 levels of difficultly with better rewards for completing each increasingly difficult mission. This is a new method that adds some goals to a standard mission.

The three levels are Normal, Heroic and Master.


     Normal Level:- Is the base mission. This has already been described above.
     Heroic Level:- Has the same basic outline of the Normal Mission but now the players will need to harvest the Saplings before the harsh environment of the badlands kills the plants.
     Master Level:- Taking Normal and Heroic levels. With the added bonus of getting the 'Harvest Saplings' of the game table in a certain amount of ACTIONS.


Each 'Level' offers new and existing OUTLAND Players a different challenge. Of course the rewards for completing each 'Level' have been increased to match the mission type.

—description from the publisher

Name: Herbalism: 2 Player Variant Rule
Description: Herbalism: 2 Player Variant Rule is a postcard-sized promo card with official rules for how to play Herbalism with only two players.

Name: SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 – Monty's EPSOM
Description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 Monty's EPSOM
This SkirmishCampaigns book is the first British-oriented book in the Normandy series and follows the British EPSOM offensive and the counter-attack by German 1st and 2nd SS Panzer Corps. 
It is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the British EPSOM offensive and the counter-attacks by the German 1st and 2nd SS Panzer Corps in Normandy from 26 June to 1 July 1944. 
The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of four campaigns. 
The book is fully compatible with its sister volumes Normandy-First Hours and Normandy-Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the British EPSOM Offensive in Normandy. This book also features an annotated bibliography of sources.

Includes:

     12 Scenarios,
     4 Campaigns


—description from the publisher

Name: Wild West Circus
Description:
Wild West Circus - it is one of the kind role-playing immersive game using large sclae miniatures and tableau. An untold story where you will be immersed and forced to make tough decisions to survive and keep the circus intact ;)

Grimtown - it is a little town in Wild West where your circus comes. You think run circus is simple? Think again. Escaped animals, blackmailed by local sheriff, paying for “protection” is just a start. Native Americans are not happy with the way you go around towns – prepare to fight them off. Successful? Great, since now you have to solve love triangle. Finally you get a secret note that there might be buried treasure in town. Will you pursue the hint or is this just a prank to keep you from things that are really important? Maybe making moonshine will be more profitable in times of “dry” season? ? Brace yourself into an adventure of your lifetime!

To play this game you will need a smart phone – so you could hear all whispers and rumors. Without your “street” knowledge it will be nearly impossible to solve mysteries and get on the good side with town’s people.

You and your fellow "managers" will have to work hand in hand in order to achieve the best result possible. The better and more thoughtful your decision are the better score you will achieve. Compare these numbers in the app with other players and see who will be the best at running Circus In the old West.

—description from the designer

Name: Herbalism: Communicating Action Card
Description: Herbalism: 2 vs 2 Variant Rule is a postcard-sized promo card with official rules for how four players can compete against one another as two teams of two players each.

Name: アニマルオークション (Animal Auction)
Fatal Flaw
Description:
Fatal Flaw is a dice-rolling real-time battle game for 2-4 players published by Button Shy Games and sent to Patreon Backers of it's Board Game of the Month Club. It consists of 4 character cards and a PDF of rules page. Player will need to provide up 2 8 dice and 40 tokens or chips in order to play.

Players each select a character and begin rolling their dice, when they think their dice are both higher than another player's they can call Hit, the game is paused and the hit is resolved. There are special rolls for blocks, heals, and special moves for each character. If a player gets 6 hits against them, they have to contend with their fatal flaw and play at a disadvantage. If a player gets 10 hits against them they are out. Last one standing wins.

Name: Universal Rule: Character Pack #1
Description:
This 6-card expansion adds 6 alien races to the game, only 2 of which are used in a given game. Players, in addition to normal actions, may attempt to ally with, or vanquish, the alien races. Allied aliens give you an ongoing effect that modifies other actions in the game, while vanquishing the aliens prevents allied effects and gains you victory points.


These alien homeworld cards are placed in the center of the table and represent the aliens that are currently in place on specific planets. If a player tried to inhabit one of those locations, they must either align with the alien and take a special power for the rest of the game -OR- vanquish the alien to gain additional stars.

Name: Universal Rule: Duplicity
Description:
Chip Beauvais has designed a full standalone expansion for Universal Rule and we're sending it out in 3 parts. This first set, which we're calling Duplicity is all about doubling abilities. Want to attack twice? Or colonize twice? These cards will allow you to bend the rules in that new way.

—description from the publisher


This expansion is included in the base game set Universal Rule: Second Wave.


A 6-card expansion to the Universal Rule family of games. This expansion adds 6 new planets to explore that adds additional rules and ways to score.

The main theme of this expansion is cards that double things.



     Escalating Edge


Planets

     Antedock
     Fixtau
     Mannisoni
     Piscius VI
     Wachu
     Zeffe



Released in the July 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Universal Rule: Attack! Attack!
Description:
This expansion is included in the base game set Universal Rule: Second Wave.


A 6-card expansion to the Universal Rule family of games. This expansion adds 5 new planets to explore and the Escalating Edge card that adds additional rules and ways to score.

The main theme of this expansion is cards that emphasize attack.



     Escalating Edge


Planets:

     Pospars
     Ascore
     Ocuchines
     Stegater
     Panthia



Released in the November 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
